abstract: Suggestion by Kansas appellate court that it may block school financing plan passed by conservative-led Legislature puts judicial and legislative branches on path to constitutional clash; plan to cut tens of millions of dollars in aid to schools is supported by Gov Sam Brownback; dispute is taking place in context of Brownback's attempts to seek greater power in selecting Supreme Court justices and of larger budget battles in the state.
lead_paragraph: A state appellate court has suggested that it might block a school financing plan that lawmakers passed; Republican leaders say the court is overstepping its bounds.

headline.main: Kansas Schools Fight Plays Out Against Backdrop of Debate on Judiciary
headline.print_headline: Kansas Schools Fight Plays Out Against Backdrop of Debate on Judiciary

snippet: A state appellate court has suggested that it might block a school financing plan that lawmakers passed; Republican leaders say the court is overstepping its bounds.
